intro: Manettia parvula, commonly known as the small-leaved manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, preferring shaded, humid environments in forests. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and fragrant blooms, making it a sought-after plant in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
